intro: Dentaria pentaphyllos, commonly known as the five-lobed toothplant, is a flowering plant native to the central and eastern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features basal leaves that are lobed and have a tooth-like appearance, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellow flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Dentaria pentaphyllos is often found in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
